title: Avro Manhattan Books (Catholicism, Vatican, Politics)
description:
Avro Manhattan Books:

-Catholic Imperialism and World Freedom
-Vietnam - Why Did We Go?
-The Vatican's Holocaust
-The Vatican Billions
-The Vatican In World Politics
-Latin America and the Vatican

Having covered various political topics throughout his career, Avro Manhattan is perhaps best remembered as the author of several works analyzing the Vatican's role in global affairs.
Manhattan is a world-renowned authority on Roman Catholicism in politics. During World War II, Manhattan was jailed in Italy for refusing to serve in Benito Mussolini's fascist army. Later during World War II he operated a radio station called "Radio Freedom," broadcasting to occupied Europe. He also wrote political commentaries for the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC).
Besides lecturing and writing short stories, essays, articles, novels and plays, he has written several best-sellers.
Despite having an intellectual outlook somewhat at odds with Christian fundamentalism, many of Manhattan's books were sold by Jack Chick, an American fundamentalist publisher.
